dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We open on a sign in large letters, “30 MINUTES LEFT.” As hand replaces “30” with “15;"” REVEAL a large room filled college students furiously racing to finish the LSAT test We pan across to the one figure who seems unfazed. MIKE R (Mets hat, short-hair, glasses, goatee) has already finis and is doodling on the back of the test. Mike notices a PROCTOR walk by, looking at him curiously. quickly turns the test over and pretends to nervously wor it. We speed up time as the “MINUTES LEFT” sign goes from “10” to “5" to 4,3,2,1. Finally the proctor yells:

dialogues.speaker: PROCTOR
dialogues.text: Time’s up. Pencils down. Mike blends in with the students and tosses his test on t pile. As he leaves, the proctor moves the pile to the sid leaving Mike’s test on top, then he taps Mike from behind

dialogues.speaker: PROCTOR
dialogues.text: Excuse me. Do I know you from somewhere? We see anxiety momentarily cross Mike’s face. He swallows then turns around to see the Proctor looking at him inten

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I don’t think so. I have a very good memory for faces. The Proctor shrugs, he must be wrong. Mike walks away. Th Proctor hesitates, thinks to himself, then turns to pick Mike’s test; the pile’s knocked over, no way to tell whic the one he wants. He turns back; no Mike. He yells...

dialogues.speaker: PROCTOR
dialogues.text: Hey! He fights through a group of students to get out the door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike’s just outside the door. He breaks into a run around the corner to a door at the end of the hall. No good, jam with students, he won’t have time to get through. As he r to his right, he trips over a GUY WEARING A METS SHIRT.  A Legal Mind 2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The proctor bursts through the throng of students and run the door where Mike just was. He sees Mike from behind. H grabs him, turns him around... it’s not Mike. The guy wit the Mets shirt is now wearing Mike’s Met’s cap. The proct looks down the hall, sees a men’s room and runs toward it INT. MEN’S ROOM - CONTINUOUS Mike is in a stall. Without his Mets cap, his hair comes down to his shoulders. He quickly removes his glasses and the fake goatee he had on and flushes them. He exits the stall, looking 100% different than he did seconds ago... INT. HALLWAY OUTSIDE MEN’S ROOM - CONTINUOUS A transformed Mike walks back down the hall with confiden He doesn’t break stride as the proctor runs by without ev noticing his existence. A small smile crosses his face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike knocks on the door of an apartment. It opens. The YOUNG MAN looks exactly like Mike did at the LSAT’s. Shor hair, glasses, goatee. Mike returns his driver’s license.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Here.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: What did you get me?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: What I said I was going to... a 158.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: I told you I wanted a 175.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: And I told you only one out of hundred people can score that. You're a B-minus student who got a thousand on the SAT’s. I get you a 175 they’1ll know you cheated.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: So only a genius loser can get a 175?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Actually, I'd get a 180. Now, can I have my money please? The Young Man hands Mike a wad of cash. Mike counts it.  A Legal Mind 3.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: This is only half.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: Then why don’t you go call the police? The Young Man slams the door in Mike's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We pan across the water to the facade of a gorgeous offic complex at the southern tip of the city. The offices in t building are all dark. Except one. We ZOOM IN:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two highly paid teams of LAWYERS SCREAM across the sleeke conference table ever made. A young lawyer, LOUIS LITT, ( slick, arrogant) quietly exits. INT. HALLWAY/KATHERINE PEARSON’S OFFICE - CONTINUOUS Louis is in the doorway of, “Katherine Pearson, Managing Partner.” Louis knocks. Katherine (50's, distinguished) doesn’t look up.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: We have a problem. The deal’s falling apart.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Go get Harvey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five well-heeled men play poker in the most expensive con in Manhattan. CLOSE ON HARVEY SPECTER, 42, with Clooney looks. He’s fit, confident, takes pride in being well- dressed. He watches as the river card is turned... A GREY HAIRED MAN smiles at Harvey as he pushes in his chips.

dialogues.speaker: GREY HAIR
dialogues.text: Raise fifty thousand.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: I’m all in. Harvey smiles back as he pushes a stack of chips three ti the size of Grey Hair’s bet into the pot. INT. KATHERINE PEARSON’S OFFICE - SAME Katherine is still at her desk. Louis knocks again.  A Legal Mind 4.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Gerald Tate is here. He wants to know what’s happening to his deal.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Louis, didn’t I tell you to get Harvey?

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Trust me, I can handle Gerald Tate. Katherine looks up as if noticing Louis for the first tim

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: No. You can’t.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey and Grey Hair are where we left them.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: The problem is, if you call, I’m going to turn over two aces, and you'll lose.

dialogues.speaker: GREY HAIR
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah. And if I fold, you’ll show me the bluff and it’1l kill me.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: If you fold, I’m not showing you anything. A beat. Grey Hair pushes his chips in. Harvey throws his cards down, revealing two aces...

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: That’s two hundred thousand. (reads a text message, then) You can pay me later... I’ve got to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GERALD TATE (55, street smart, ex-prize fighter) yells at Katherine. Harvey saunters in unnoticed in his $4,000 sui

dialogues.speaker: GERALD
dialogues.text: I don’t care who’s on his way. I'm paying you millions, and you’re telling me I’m going to get screwed?!

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Katherine, have I come at a bad time? She cracks a smile. The cavalry is here. She hands Harvey stack of deal memos. Harvey proceeds to examine them.  A Legal Mind A moment.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Gerald, I'd like you to meet Harvey Specter. He’s our best attorney.

dialogues.speaker: GERALD
dialogues.text: If you’re their best attorney, where the hell have you been the last three hours? Harvey speaks calmly while scanning the memos.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Well, Gerald, I specialize in troubled situations. And when I left here at 7:00 PM this deal wasn’t in jeopardy. So, what I’m trying to do now is understand what happened in the interim.

dialogues.speaker: GERALD
dialogues.text: We keep raising the price and they keep rejecting it. It’s last minute bad faith bullshit. Harvey ignores Gerald and continues scanning.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: It says here Cooper's no longer staying on as honorary Vice President.

dialogues.speaker: GERALD
dialogues.text: That’s right. I don’t want him around.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: He... wouldn’t be around. It’s an honorary position.

dialogues.speaker: GERALD
dialogues.text: I don’t give a crap. Harvey puts the memo down and looks Gerald in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: I think you do. Because that’s what changed since I left. Which means it’s you who’s been dealing in bad faith.

dialogues.speaker: GERALD
dialogues.text: Well, now that you’ve gotten a handle on what’s happened in the God damn interim, what are you going to do about it? Because he’s not getting that title. Harvey casually pours a glass of water.  A Legal Mind 6. He offers

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Let me just make sure I understand. We negotiated a deal that got you everything you wanted. Mr. Cooper signed it. And now you won’t close until we take away the last shred of his dignity?

dialogues.speaker: GERALD
dialogues.text: Bingo.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Well, that’s not going to happen. the water. Gerald looks at it with contempt, then:

dialogues.speaker: GERALD
dialogues.text: Why the hell not?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Because I like Mr. Cooper. And my firm doesn’t operate in bad faith. Harvey drinks the water himself.

dialogues.speaker: GERALD
dialogues.text: How I see it is, instead of working Cooper, you’re working me. So take your faggoty attitude back in there and make him sign my deal or I'll pay someone else your money to do it for me.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: First of all, Gerald, if you think anyone is gonna touch this deal after your bad faith, you’re mistaken. Second, the way our agreement works is the minute Cooper signed the deal that gave you everything you wanted, our fee was due and payable. Harvey reaches into his jacket pocket.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Which is why at 7:30, I received confirmation of a wire transfer from escrow indicating payment in full. He removes a fax.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: I would say the ball’s in your court, but the truth is your balls are in my fist. I apologize if that image is too faggoty for you, but I’m comfortable enough with my manhood to put it out there.  A Legal Mind 7. Harvey holds out the fax to Gerald, who is dumbstruck.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Now get your ass in there and close this God damn deal.

dialogues.speaker: GERALD
dialogues.text: (to Katherine) You let him talk to me like this?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Harvey speaks for the firm. Gerald exits the office. Katherine leans in to Harvey.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: We got paid before Gerald signed the deal?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: This is a memo about some fire drill on Tuesday. By the way, you’re blue team captain. You get to wear a fire hat. INT. TREVOR STEVENS’ CONDOMINIUM —- CONTINUOUS Leather couch, plasma TV, weed on the table; this is the of a bachelor with serious disposable income. TREVOR, cle cut, 22, suit and tie, takes a bite of a cheeseburger and savors it. Mike looks at the bong, shakes his head to himself and then turns to Trevor..

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I've got to get my shit together.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: This is the best cheeseburger I’ve ever had in my life.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: It's from Monday. Trevor, I’m serious. I almost got caught today, then my client stiffed me for half. I’m sick of this life. I’ve gotta stop getting stoned and get my act together.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: Dude, look at me. You can bake up and still be a success.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: You sell pot for a living.  A Legal Mind 8.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: It still saps the motivation. Look, all I’m saying is, you want in, you are in.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: That's basically your offer before I got caught cheating on your math test in third grade.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: Goddamn memory.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: And by the way, it’s your offer on every shady thing you’ve gotten me involved in.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: How was I supposed to know that chick was the dean’s daughter? Look, nobody’s ever going to suspect you’re a dealer. Trevor indicates his clean cut image and suit and tie.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: Look at me. This is a two-thousand dollar suit, I’ve got twelve of them. Trevor starts counting on his fingers.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: I have an office, I take on real software projects, my clients wear suits... They give me briefcases of cash, I give them identical briefcases with vacuum sealed bud. I’m telling you, hide in plain sight... oldest trick in the book.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: So what do you need me for?

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: I leave town tomorrow, I’ve got a client coming in wants to meet at the Ritz. I need somebody I trust to make the drop. It’s totally safe. Come on, help me out.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: You know, one stands a greater chance of dying while dealing drugs than on death row in Texas. Which begs the question: why would anyone deal drugs?

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?  A Legal Mind 9.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: It’s from “Freakonomics,” which I suggest you read. But whether you do or you don’t, you'll have to find someone else, because I’m not interested.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Not interested in what? JENNY GRIFFITH, Trevor's girlfriend, has entered the cond without them noticing. She’s 22, dresses like a student, has no idea that Trevor deals pot. Trevor is defensive.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: What are you doing here? I thought you were sleeping at your place tonight.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: (what he should have said) Hey, sweetie, what a pleasant surprise. I’m so glad you stopped by. She kisses Trevor then turns to Mike.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Not interested in what? Mike and Trevor share a look, “What should we say?”

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Trevor's trying to set me up.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: (covering) That's terrific. Who’s the lucky girl?

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: I was trying to get him to work for me.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: (brightening) That's a great idea. It would take some stress off of Trevor. And you’d pick up writing code like you do everything else.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I’m gonna take off. I’ve got to get up early to see my grandmother. As Mike heads out, Jenny squeezes his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey and Katherine sit surrounded by beautiful people.  A Legal Mind 10.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: By the way, I’ve set up a meeting with you and John Dockery next week.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Dockery? He’s Skadden’s biggest client.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Not anymore. He’s looking around. He's asked us to do a preliminary evaluation of his corporate structure and assess where he’s vulnerable to a takeover. I want you to charm him and close him.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Consider it done. A stunning WAITRESS approaches with their drinks. As Katherine takes hers, she indicates Harvey to the waitres

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Miss, you are looking at the best closer this city has ever seen.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: (to waitress, not embarrassed) Katherine, please you're embarrassing me.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: Closer, huh? Baseball?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Attorney. I close situations.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: So all you care about is money?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: The truth is... I do it for the children.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: Handsome, wealthy, and funny... what do you think you’re some kind of super hero?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: I don’t like to toot my own horn. I feel that question is best answered by one of the many people whose lives I've saved. She laughs.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: I’m Lisa.  A Legal Mind 11.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Harvey.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Well, Harvey, I don’t usually do this, but I’m off in ten minutes. You want to take me out for a drink?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Your timing couldn’t be more perfect. Katherine here was just leaving. Katherine is just starting to sip her full drink. INT. MIKE’S STUDIO APARTMENT - NEXT MORNING The unit’s barely larger than the table at the law firm. Mike is asleep on a pullout that takes up the entire plac An alarm rings. Mike hits snooze and goes back to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katherine is eating an early breakfast with her mentor, PHILLIP, a distinguished man in his seventies. His elegan appointed home resembles the Metropolitan Museum of Art.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: .+-point is I can see myself stepping down as senior partner in five years.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: Seems like it’s only been ten minutes since I handed the reins to you.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: It hasn't. Time just moves a lot faster when you’re a hundred and sixty. She smiles. There’s a pause...

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: What’s the matter?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: How did you know I was your successor?

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: The truth? My gut. It told me you were the only one with the balls for the job.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: That's what I was afraid you were going to say. My gut tells me it’s Harvey. But my heart tells me he’s not ready.  A Legal Mind 12.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: What’s he missing?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Compassion.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: Makes sense. The killer instinct that makes him a great lawyer is what concerns you about making him senior partner.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Exactly. If the leader of a firm doesn’t care about the people who work for him or the clients he represents... there won’t be much of a firm left to lead. Phillip refills her coffee.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: You know, you weren’t completely ready. And he does have some years to learn.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: But compassion. I’m not sure you can learn that.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: What are you going to do about it?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: What would you do about it?

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: A man’s missing compassion? I'd shove it down his throat.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: I imagine the opportunity will present itself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Expansive, overlooking Central Park... if this bedroom we an apartment, it’d go for $7,000 a month. Harvey leans ov a sleeping Lisa, the waitress from the night before and g her a kiss. She looks at the time.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Lisa, this was lovely, but it’s time to go. I need to be in the office by 7:30.  A Legal Mind 13.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Can’t we hang out a little? I can make you some breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: As tempting as that sounds, I’m afraid I hate to miss a workout, and I really want to get into the office before 7:30.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: That’s too bad. I was thinking maybe you could eat it off my stomach. She pulls her shirt up. Harvey takes in her fantastic bod

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: I guess if I skip the gym, I can still get in by nine. INT. NURSING HOME HALLWAY/MIKE’S GRANDMOTHER’S ROOM - LAT Mike walks with the head physician at his grandmother's nursing home, DOCTOR SHRAGER. She’s a kindly, older woman

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR SHRAGER
dialogues.text: Your grandmother's getting worse. I need to move her to full care, or I'll have to transfer her to a state facility.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I won’t put her in a state facility.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR SHRAGER
dialogues.text: Then you’1l have to come up with $10,000.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Then I will. They stop outside a room. Shrager pats Mike affectionatel then exits. Mike’s GRANDMOTHER (75, frail) is reading. He approaches her. They hug. Mike sees her meds on the table

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I hear you’re not taking your pills.

dialogues.speaker: GRAMMY
dialogues.text: Because they’re trying to poison me.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: That’s nonsense. Doctor Shrager assured me she wouldn’t poison you until January at the earliest. She reached this year’s quota, and if she does it before January, she can’t count it as a 2009 poisoning.  A Legal Mind 14. She eyes Mike suspiciously, then takes the pills.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Now what did I teach you? She and Mike tap fists.

dialogues.speaker: GRAMMY
dialogues.text: Michael, I’m worried about you. I’m not going to be around forever, and -- I want you to stop with that... stuff.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: You... know about that?

dialogues.speaker: GRAMMY
dialogues.text: I’ve got early stage Alzheimer’s, I’m not an idiot. I know life’s been hard for you, and you went looking for comfort. But comfort has consequences. You’re not a kid anymore. I want you to promise you'll start living up to your potential.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I promise. She takes her book and starts reading. Mike sees the book upside down. He tears up and walks out. INT. KATHERINE’S OFFICE/HALLWAY - 9:30 AM Harvey enters to see Katherine and Louis.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: 9:30. Nice of you to join us, Harvey. And I see you're dressed like a pimp.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: My bad, Louis, I was out late after the huge deal I closed for the firm last night, and when I woke up, this was the suit your wife picked out for me. Harvey casually takes a sip of his coffee.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Moving along. Harvey, interviews are set up at the Ritz tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: What? Why didn’t we just hire that Harvard summer intern douche?  A Legal Mind

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: I think if you listen to the phrasing of that question, you’1l come up with the answer.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: What do you expect from Harvard? Book smarts, no street smarts. We need people with balls who can think on their feet, not another clone with a rod up his ass.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Harvey, the fact that we only hire from Harvard gives us a cache that’s more valuable than a kid from SUNY Binghamton. Harvey indicates that he can’t hear...

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Louis, if you’re going to talk out of your ass, you have to remove the rod.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: You went to Harvard Law.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: I’m an exception.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Then find another one.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Then let me skip the recruiting. I work alone anyway.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: I would, Harvey, but all partners get an associate. It’s just a rule. Louis, caught off-guard turns to Katherine heatedly.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: What? I deserve that partnership. I run the lower level associates, my billable hours destroy his and I am here night and day doing whatever’s asked of me instead of swanning in and out whenever I please.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: I have to admit, he does make me sound very swan-like.  A Legal Mind 16.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Watch it, Harvey. You’re not partner yet, and I’ve been an attorney here two years longer than you.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Yet the only skill you've developed is kissing Katherine's ass.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Harvey, you won, shut up. Louis, this is how it is. Now you two make nice.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Louis, I’m sorry. I was out of line with the ass-kissing comment and I apologize. Harvey holds his hand out. Louis reluctantly shakes it.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Now if you’ll excuse me, I have to call your wife and tell her the man she loves just made partner. (off Katherine’s disapproval) What? Too far? Come on, it’s my way of showing there’s no hard feelings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike walks through the hallways. He dials his cell. Then:

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Trevor, I’m in. One time deal, I want twenty-five. Take it or leave it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor's with THREE WELL-DRESSED MEN holding weapons. They're surrounded by briefcases filled with cash and marijuana. Intercut Trevor and Mike.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: I‘ll take it. There’s a briefcase in my room with the stuff, pick it up tomorrow. But you can’t take it into a luxury hotel looking like a delivery guy. So you need to shave, get a haircut and buy a suit.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: That’s a hell of a lot to ask.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: I’m not just asking you. I’m paying you twenty-five thousand dollars.  A Legal Mind 17.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey approaches his career-long secretary, DONNA. She’s her 30's, good-looking, and would take a bullet for Harve

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Donna, clear my day tomorrow. You and I are hiring a new associate.

dialogues.speaker: DONNA
dialogues.text: Done. Harvey checks to make sure no one’s looking. Then, quietl

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Does this suit make me look like a pimp? Donna holds out her palm, indicating maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor hangs up the phone and turns to the main dealer.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: He’s in. I’m gonna grab a beer. Trevor exits. The main dealer turns to an underling.

dialogues.speaker: DEALER
dialogues.text: Good. In twenty four hours we’1ll know if this new buyer’s a cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor turns back around -- he forgot something. He hears

dialogues.speaker: DEALER
dialogues.text: Why didn’t you tell Trevor he might be sending the guy into set up?

dialogues.speaker: DEALER
dialogues.text: Same reason I don’t tell Gina I’m bangin’ her sister. It’ll only cause trouble... The dealer and his cronies laugh. Trevor's face falls as Dealer #1 comes around the corner. Trevor smiles weakly..

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: I was just thinking I should get going.

dialogues.speaker: DEALER
dialogues.text: No. You shouldn't.

dialogues.speaker: END OF ACT ONE
dialogues.text: A Legal Mind 18.

dialogues.speaker: ACT TWO
dialogues.text: INT. TREVOR STEVENS’ CONDOMINIUM —- NEXT MORNING Mike, clean cut and wearing a suit, grabs the briefcase a heads for the door. Jenny enters. Mike is startled.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: You scared the hell out of me.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Sorry. Look at you. You look great. Tell me you decided to work with Trevor.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Trial basis. What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Wanna hear something ridiculous? My mom is coming by my place later and I don’t want to mess it up, so I’m hanging here.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: That’s not so bad.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: That’s not the ridiculous part. After I finish scouring the place for her visit, I sprinkle a tee-ny bit of crumbs around.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Because I don’t want her to think I scour the place just for her visit.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: That is ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: I know. That’s what I just said. Mike and Jenny share a smile. He starts out, she stops hi

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: You want to look perfect your first day. Jenny fixes Mike’s tie, it’s very intimate. She finishes, noticing he’s staring at her. A moment, then:

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Do you ever wonder what would have happened if you and I had met first?  A Legal Mind 19.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (beat) I've got to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DONNA sits at a desk, waiting for the wave of interviewee Harvey pokes his head out of the inner room.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Donna, do me a favor, give each guy a hard time before you send him back. Then give me a wink if they say something clever.

dialogues.speaker: DONNA
dialogues.text: What are you looking for?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: I've gotta work with this guy a long time. I’ve got to understand him, relate to him, and trust him. Which means I’m looking for another me.

dialogues.speaker: DONNA
dialogues.text: Got it. Witty, charming, ballsy, thinks he’s the smartest one in the room...

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: That’s why I love you. You get me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike enters to see a group of students under a sign: “Har Law Interviews: Suite 205." They’re dressed like Mike: bl suits, white shirts, blue ties. Mike heads inside, nervou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A young, straight-laced applicant stands in front of Donn

dialogues.speaker: DONNA
dialogues.text: What gives you the nerve to think we're going to let the whitest person I’ve ever seen interview for our law firm?

dialogues.speaker: INTERVIEWEE
dialogues.text: I... Because... I have an appointment. Harvey checks to see if she’ll wink: She shakes her head

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike stands in front of the mirror, puts water on his fac wipes it off, and looks at himself. He takes a deep breat  A Legal Mind 20.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: You can do this. He picks up his briefcase, and heads out of the bathroom. follow Mike back to the lobby. An elevator arrives. DING. Mike steels himself, gets on, and presses the fourth floo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another applicant stands in front of Donna. He’s very sho

dialogues.speaker: DONNA
dialogues.text: Wow. Are you sure you’re tall enough to go on this ride? He answers in an extremely high-pitched, meek voice.

dialogues.speaker: INTERVIEWEE
dialogues.text: I don’t appreciate derogatory statements about my physical characteristics. Harvey looks out: Donna, amused, shakes her head no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike exits the elevator. He checks his watch: thirty seco to ten. He walks down the hallway slowly. There’s a BELLM in a RED uniform walking a MAN IN A SUIT to suite 412. FLASHBACK MIKE’S MEMORY - RITZ-CARLTON ENTRANCE EARLIER We see the scene as Mike entered; the uniforms are BLUE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something isn’t right. The two men are staying in the roo entrance. Mike continues walking slowly. FLASHBACK MIKE’S MEMORY - RITZ-CARLTON ENTRANCE EARLIER Again, the scene as Mike entered the hotel. This time the is a sign, “Pool is Closed Due to Construction.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike keeps walking toward them. He approaches the bellman

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Excuse me, I was thinking of going for a swim. Are the pool facilities here nice?

dialogues.speaker: BELLMAN
dialogues.text: Of course, sir, this is the Ritz-Carlton.  A Legal Mind

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Thank you. (to man in suit) Oh and do you have the time? The man in the suit holds out his arm to Mike sees that he’s got a gun inside his

dialogues.speaker: SUIT
dialogues.text: It’s ten o’clock.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Thank you. 21. check his watch, jacket pocket. Mike walks down the hall and turns the corner.

dialogues.speaker: BELLMAN
dialogues.text: He saw your gun.

dialogues.speaker: SUIT
dialogues.text: You think that’s him?

dialogues.speaker: BELLMAN
dialogues.text: Matches the description. But he didn’t go in the room.

dialogues.speaker: SUIT
dialogues.text: It’s ten exactly, he’s just walking by?

dialogues.speaker: BELLMAN
dialogues.text: It is a hotel.

dialogues.speaker: SUIT
dialogues.text: And by coincidence our guy’s nowhere in sight.

dialogues.speaker: BELLMAN
dialogues.text: What do you want me to do? If our guy shows up, you don’t look right standing here without a bellman.

dialogues.speaker: SUIT
dialogues.text: Go after him. Stay on the radio. The bellman runs around the corner. The At the end of it is a stairway. He runs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike books down the stairs, as he passes hallway is empty. toward it. — CONTINUOUS the third floor landing, the briefcase SLAMS into the stairway railing.  A Legal Mind 22. FLASHBACK MIKE’S MEMORY - RITZ-CARLTON ENTRANCE EARLIER The group of Harvard Law students pass in front of Mike. Again the sign reads, “Harvard Law Interviews: Suite 205.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike lands on the stairwell, again the briefcase gets SLA as he bursts into the hall. As the door slowly closes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bellman opens the stairway door. He looks down... nothing. He looks up... nothing. Click. He hears the second floor door close. He races down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A nervous, young-looking INTERVIEWEE #3, approaches Donna

dialogues.speaker: DONNA
dialogues.text: Kid, what's wrong with you? You look like you're eleven years old.

dialogues.speaker: INTERVIEWEE
dialogues.text: (extremely nervous) I... I was late to puberty. The Kid runs out. Harvey sticks his head out. Donna throw up her hands. Donna calls out to the other applicants.

dialogues.speaker: DONNA
dialogues.text: Rick Sorkin?... Rick Sorkin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike tries to stop breathing heavily as he walks the hall toward Suite 205. He opens the door to the suite. It is filled with men who look and are dressed exactly like him

dialogues.speaker: DONNA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Mr. Sorkin, you’re five minutes late. Do you have a reason I should let you in? Mike looks over to see Donna. He stares at her. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I’m only here to ditch the cops. I don’t care if you let me in or not. Harvey opens the door to meet Mike. Donna gives him a win As Mike enters the door, we see that the latch on the briefcase has come loose from being slammed...  A Legal Mind 23.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Harvey shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Rick Sorkin.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Harvey Specter. Nice to meet you. As they shake hands, the briefcase bursts open. Harvey se the mound of pot. Mike looks busted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bellman enters and realizes there are twenty men who exactly like Mike. He looks suspiciously at everyone.

dialogues.speaker: DONNA
dialogues.text: Can I help you? INT. GERALD TATE’S OFFICE - CONTINUOUS Gerald sits at his desk. His secretary appears at the doo

dialogues.speaker: SECRETARY
dialogues.text: There's a Louis Litt here to see you.

dialogues.speaker: GERALD
dialogues.text: Who the hell is Louis Litt?

dialogues.speaker: SECRETARY
dialogues.text: He says he’s your lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: GERALD
dialogues.text: Send him in. The secretary exits. A moment. Louis appears at the door.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Mr. Tate, I have information that I believe will lead you to the conclusion that you’re better served at Pearson, Hardman with me as your lead counsel.

dialogues.speaker: GERALD
dialogues.text: Come in, have a seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey and Mike sit together. Harvey leans in, fascinated

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: How did you know they were the police?  A Legal Mind

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I read a novel in elementary school. The cops were staking out a hotel and they posed as a bellhop and a man in a suit. It was the exact same thing.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: You read a novel in elementary school?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: What? I like to read.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Why did you ask them what time it was?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: To throw them off. What drug dealer asks a cop what time it is while he’s carrying a briefcase full of pot? Harvey shakes his head in awe.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Now that is ballsy thinking under fire. We should hire you. Jesus, I'd give you the twenty-five grand as a signing bonus.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I'll take it.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Unfortunately, we only hire from Harvard. And you not only didn’t go to Harvard Law School, you didn’t go to any law school.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: What if I told you I consume knowledge like no one you’ve ever met, and I've actually passed the bar? Harvey looks at Mike, “I'd say you’re full of shit.” points at a book sticking out of Harvey's bag.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I notice you have a Barbri Legal Handbook with you. Open it up, read me something. Harvey looks skeptical, but he opens up the book.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: “Civil liability associated with agency is based on several factors including --” 24. Mike  A Legal Mind 25.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: “-~ the deviation of the agent from his path, the reasonable inference of agency on behalf of the plaintiff, and the nature of the damages themselves.”

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: (looking up, stunned) How did you do that?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I learned it when I studied for the bar.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Okay, hot shot, fire up that laptop, I’‘1l show you what a Harvard Attorney can do. That's my database of every legal issue in existence. Pick one. Harvey jumps up and points for Mike to sit at his laptop. Mike punches the arrow key a couple times and hits enter.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Stock option backdating.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Although backdating options is legal, violations arise related to disclosures under both FASB 123R and Internal Revenue Code Section 409A.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: You forgot The Sarbanes Oxley Act of ‘02.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: The statute of limitations renders Sarbanes Oxley moot post 2007. Mike peers closely at the screen while clicking the mouse

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Not if you can find actions to cover up the violation, as established in the sixth circuit, May 2008.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Impressive, but you are at a computer.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (turning the screen to Harvey) I’ve been playing hearts: If you’re gonna beat me, it better be at something else. Harvey is stunned.  A Legal Mind 26.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: How can you know all that --

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I told you. I like to read. And once I read something, I understand it. And once I understand it, I never forget it.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Why take the bar?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Some dickhead bet me I couldn’t pass it without going to law school.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: How long did he give you to study?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Four months. It was two months longer than I needed. Harvey begins to actually consider Mike’s proposition.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Do you really want this job?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: When I was in college my dream was to be a lawyer. My grandmother needed money and Trevor convinced me to memorize some math test and sell it. Turns out we sold it to the dean’s daughter. I lost my scholarship and got thrown out of school. Mike pauses, as if remembering how it felt... then:

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I got knocked into a different life, I’ve been wishing for a way back ever since.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: I had someone take a chance on me once. But before she did, she made damn sure I was committed to the job. I’m talking about work. Long hours, high pressure, no fucking around. I need an adult.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: You give me this, I’1ll work as hard as it takes to school those Harvard douches, and be the best lawyer you’ve ever seen. Harvey looks at a piece of paper he’s written something o  A Legal Mind 27.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: I’m inclined to give you a shot. But what if I decide to go another way?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I'd say, fine. Sometimes I like to hang out with people that aren’t that bright just to see how the other half lives. We see the paper says, “Thinks he’s the smartest one in t room.” Harvey grins:

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Move over. I’m emailing the firm I’ve found our next associate. (as he types) By the way, the bet with the dickhead, how much was it for?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (joking) Aaah, I can’t remember. They both laugh. Harvey is finished emailing.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: All right, you start a week from Monday. Here’s what you’re gonna do... INT. MIKE’S STUDIO APARTMENT - TWO DAYS LATER Mike packs a small bag with a couple of days worth of clo as the rest of their conversation continues in voice over

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: First off, that’s it for the pot. We drug test. Stop now, you’ll be fine. I assume that’s all the drugs you do.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (Harvey was on the money) How do you know that?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You read books, I read people. And pot heads smoke pot. That’s what they do.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: That’s not all I do. Mike takes a tiny bag of pot and heads into the bathroom.  A Legal Mind 28.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You're Albert freaking Einstein, but you couldn’t manage to go to law school. You think that’s not from pot?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Trevor got me kicked out of college. How would I have gotten into law school? Mike hesitates, then flushes the bag down the toilet.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: That's another thing. You’re gonna ditch that briefcase and your boy Trevor. Mike checks his cell: he’s had six missed calls from Trev

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Then you’re gonna get on a plane to Harvard and you’re gonna learn everything there is about going to law school there. Mike pulls out the briefcase with the pot from behind the couch. He shoves it to the back of his oven, puts a coupl pizza boxes in front to hide it, closes the oven and exit

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Now get out of here. Oh, one more thing, buy some better suits. You look like a Bar Mitzvah boy. And not in a good way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane takes off as we hear the flight attendant.

dialogues.speaker: FLIGHT ATTENDANT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen, welcome to Delta Flight 96 with direct service to Boston.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike approaches a dour looking old woman behind a desk.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Excuse me, I was wondering how to sign up for the four o’clock law school tour?

dialogues.speaker: OLD WOMAN
dialogues.text: You go back in time six weeks, because that’s when the four o’clock booked up. (off Mike’s look) This is Harvard Law School, we get over seven thousand applications a year. You think you just walk in and take a tour?  A Legal Mind 29.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty people with name tags are in front of a sign: “Har Law School Tour.” Mike sees a very cocky-looking YOUNG MA by himself. Mike approaches and reads his name tag...

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Clifford Watkins?

dialogues.speaker: CLIFFORD WATKINS
dialogues.text: (air of superiority) Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: My name is Jonathan Atwater, I work for Dean Wormer in the admissions office. Clifford's attitude instantly changes.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFFORD WATKINS
dialogues.text: Yes, of course, what can I --

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Dean Wormer personally sent me to invite you to an intimate cocktail hour for some of our more... realistic candidates. Clifford surveys the people around him and smiles knowing

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: We'd like to be discreet, so if you'd be so kind as to subtly hand me your name tag you can proceed to the Dean’s office. Clifford smiles smugly, hands Mike his name tag and exits As Mike dons Clifford’s name tag, a YOUNG WOMAN approache As she starts the tour, Mike follows, taking in Harvard..

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG WOMAN
dialogues.text: Harvard Law is the oldest law school in the country and boasts the most successful graduates in the world. Currently, we are six of nine Supreme Court Justices, and of course, the President of the United States... Mike’s going up against the smartest lawyers in the world

dialogues.speaker: END OF ACT TWO
dialogues.text: A Legal Mind 30.

dialogues.speaker: ACT THREE
dialogues.text: INT. MIKE’S STUDIO APARTMENT —- FOLLOWING MONDAY Close on a closet with three suits, numerous shirts and t A hand reaches in and pulls out a blue suit, white shirt, tie. Pullback to see that it is Mike. He lays his ensembl on the couch and then heads into the shower. INT. MIKE’S STUDIO APARTMENT - A LITTLE LATER Mike is now out of the shower. He puts his ensemble back the closet and picks out a brown suit, blue shirt and blu tie. He lays these out, then goes to shave. INT. MIKE’S STUDIO APARTMENT - A LITTLE LATER We are close on Mike, tying his tie in the mirror. We pul back to see that he’s changed his ensemble again and is n wearing a grey suit, white shirt and blue tie. He looks i the mirror, likes what he sees, and heads out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike comes up from the subway with an excitement in his s that only comes on the first day of a new career. His cel rings, it’s Trevor again. He silences it and keeps walkin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike enters the lobby. As he takes in the grandeur of the firm, the import of what he’s doing finally hits him... H approaches the receptionist nervously...

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Hi, I’m here to see Harvey... oh, my God, I can’t think of his last name. I’m so nervous, I’m not sure I know my last name.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Ross. Mike Ross. Mike turns to see RACHEL LANE, an attractive paralegal. H been hit by a bolt of lightning. He stands there agog...

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: We've been expecting you. I’m Rachel Lane, paralegal. I’11 be giving you your orientation. She reaches to shake his hand. He blurts out...

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Wow, you’re pretty.  A Legal Mind 31.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Good, you've hit on me. We can get it out of the way that I’m not interested.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (sincere) I wasn’t hitting on you. I --

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Please. I’ve given dozens of these, and without fail, whatever new hotshot it is thinks because I’m just a paralegal, I’‘1l be blown away by his dazzling degree. Let me assure you that I won’t.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (realizing) I was. I was hitting on you. She hands him a pad and pen.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Now, take notes because I’m not going to repeat myself. Rachel turns and starts walking. Mike mouths to himself:

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I love you. As Mike follows we see him take in the firm. The banks of offices lining the walls are fantastic. The interior wall are glass, and we see right through them to stunning view downtown Manhattan. The interior of the firm is filled wi cubicles of secretaries, paralegals, and associates.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Each bank of offices specializes in its own arena of the law and is anchored by Department Heads at either end. On my left is mergers and acquisitions, on the opposite side is high net worth divorce.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Mergers across from divorce. Symmetry. (off her look) I‘1l just listen.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: The firm operates on a chain of command model. Harvey’s your commanding officer. However, Louis Litt oversees all associates so you also answer to him.  A Legal Mind 32.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: What do you think about Harvey?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: People are in awe of him, they say he’s the best instinctive attorney anyone's ever seen, but I have very little contact with him, so I don’t really know.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: What about Louis Litt? Rachel looks at Mike, it’s clear she doesn’t think much o Louis Litt, but doesn’t know Mike well enough to tell him

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Let’s get on with your tour..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey arrives, strutting through the halls, even cockier than usual. As he passes people, he points at them, snaps his fingers, and generally acts like he is king of the wo

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Hey, Becky, you are glowing. I wonder why that is? Oh, yeah, it’s the day they announce my partnership. Nancy, have you lost weight? Steve-o, looking... Steve-o is sloppy, fat and ugly.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: ...like a guy who came to work. Harvey heads to his door, which has “Harvey Specter, Part newly stenciled on it. He stops short as a WORKER scratch the “Partner” off his door. Harvey remains unfazed.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Excuse me, why are you scratching the “Partner” off my door?

dialogues.speaker: WORKER
dialogues.text: I got a work order to take it off.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Who issued the work order?

dialogues.speaker: WORKER
dialogues.text: My supervisor.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Why did he issue the work order?  A Legal Mind 33.

dialogues.speaker: WORKER
dialogues.text: If I knew that, I’d be his supervisor.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: You seem to be enjoying yourself.

dialogues.speaker: WORKER
dialogues.text: I haven't enjoyed myself since 2004. Harvey laughs. Donna shows up at the door.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Donna, somebody's trying to play a joke --

dialogues.speaker: DONNA
dialogues.text: Katherine wants you in her office now. Harvey's face falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel arrives with Mike at his cubicle.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Finally, this is where you'll live. (then, re: Mike’s note pad) What’s wrong with you? I gave you that for a reason, you haven’t taken one note.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: That’s... because --

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Because you’ve been too busy ogling me to listen to a word I’ve said. Mike looks Rachel straight in the eye, but points at the various locations around the office as he refers to them.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Partner's offices anchor the wings; fifth floor’s research, sixth is security; any work gets billed even if it’s finding an address; I answer to Harvey and Louis Litt and judging by how you responded to my questions, I should admire Harvey and fear Louis. You’ve been here five years and just because I outrank you, I have no authority to command your services. (off her amazement) Oh, it’s also clear you think you're too smart to be a paralegal. That cover it? Rachel looks at him, impressed. A beat. She covers:  A Legal Mind 34.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: You know, nobody likes a show-off.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: But... you challenged me. You used the word ogling... Rachel is walking away.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Where are you going? When do I get to see Harvey? INT. KATHERINE PEARSON’S OFFICE - MOMENTS LATER Katherine is at her desk. Harvey’s standing in front of h

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Gerald Tate fired the firm.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: What?! When?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: An hour ago. When you were supposed to be here.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: So you're taking my partnership away?! Katherine stands up, heatedly.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Damn it, Harvey, most firms would put you in front of the bar on ethics charges and have your license stripped. You lied to a client and he figured it out.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: I lied to him to get him to do the right thing and honor his goddamn contract.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Be that as it may, you didn’t get away with it. And I can’t justify handing you a partnership the same day you lose a huge client.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: One client doesn’t --  A Legal Mind 35. This just

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: One client? We’re in an economic shit storm. Companies aren’t lining up to spend money on attorneys right now. sits there a minute.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: You know, he might have forgiven the lying if you hadn’t humiliated him, but you did. And you need to accept that. Harvey realizes he isn’t going to change Katherine’s mind Katherine

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Katherine, if you hadn’t done as much for me as you have, I'd be heading for the door. smiles.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: If I hadn’t done as much for you as I have, I’d be throwing you out the window. Harvey starts to leave.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: But Harvey, any shenanigans, you try to leave and take one client, tell one more lie... do one more thing that isn’t straight as an arrow, and instead of covering your ass, I’1l put you in front of the bar myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey enters, dejected. He doesn’t see Mike sitting ther

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Who's ready for a great first day?!

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Mike, I’m going to have to let you go.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: I just got my ass reamed for lying to a client. If they find out I lied about you going to Harvard Law School, they’1l take away my license.  A Legal Mind 36.

dialogues.speaker: DONNA, (ON INTERCOM)
dialogues.text: You what?!

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY, (INTO INTERCOM)
dialogues.text: Not now, Donna. (then, to Mike) I have to put my own interests above yours. It’s not personal. You're fired.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (putting it together) So, you're worried if I stay, they might find out you lied about me and you’1l lose your license. But if you fire me, I could tell them you lied about me and you'd definitely lose your license.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This pisses Harvey off.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Are you saying if I throw you under the bus, you’re going to drag me with you?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: You put your interests above mine. I’m just putting mine back up next to yours.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: I like that. You just gave me an idea. You're rehired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katherine is on the phone. Harvey storms in and hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Here's what’s going to happen. You’re going to tell that workman to put the “Partner” back on my door and that’s the last we're going to talk about this.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: And why is that?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Because if you don’t, I'm going across town to join Cynthia Harris. And then I'm going to approach every client I've ever closed, I’m going to put my charm on them, and I’m going to take them with me.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: If you do that, you’ll force me to put you in front of the ethics board.  A Legal Mind 37.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: I don’t think you’1l put me in front of the ethics board.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Because you were obligated to notify them the second you knew I lied to Gerald, but you didn’t. You put me in front of the board now, you’ll be up there with me. Katherine turns her back to Harvey in frustration. A beat We see a smile cross her face. This is her plan. She lets out a deep breath and turns back to him, feigning defeat.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: I'll give you the partnership, but you're going to have to do something for me. Harvey grins.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Anything. What do you need? Katherine holds up a file.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Take on a pro bono.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Anything but that...

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Harvey, we all do it, even me. Pro bono cases are how we as a firm show that we care about more than just ourselves. And it’s how you can show people in the firm you care about more than just yourself.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: I just did one.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: That was six years ago.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: You didn’t let me finish. I was going to say I just did one six years ago. Harvey holds out his hand, he’1ll take the case.  A Legal Mind 38.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: You'll handle it yourself? You won’t pass it off to the new kid?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Absolutely. Katherine hands him the file. He heads to the door.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: You want the “Partner” stenciled in bold, or underlined, or what?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Something subtle. In neon. Katherine smiles as Harvey exits the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike sits in a chair. Harvey tosses him the pro bono file

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Your first case. Donna set up a meeting with you and the client this afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Awesome. What is it?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Pro bono. Sexual harassment. It’s beneath me, but it’s important to Katherine. So, don’t tell anyone I laid it off on you and don’t screw it up... Mike starts out.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Wait a second. Didn’t I tell you to get some better suits?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? (re: suit) This is Men’s Wearhouse. I spent four hundred dollars. Harvey senses something’s not right.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: For how many suits?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Five. What?  A Legal Mind 39.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike is interviewing his client, Nancy, an attractive waitress in her mid-thirties. They sit in a booth.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Please, Nancy, take me through the story as you see it.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: It started two years ago. I was a proud stay-at-home mother to our son, Freddie. One day, after little league... She smiles, reminiscing...

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Freddie was seven. Hated that he couldn't play with the older kids... Nancy gets serious again...

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: We came home to find my husband on the floor of our bathroom. He died of a heart attack. Just like that...

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: I was devastated, but I didn’t have the time - I didn’t have the luxury to grieve. So, I did the best I could, I got myself a job as a secretary at Devlin McGreggor. Nancy becomes upbeat again as she remembers...

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: I felt good about providing for me and Freddie, I even got promoted to secretary of the President, Charles Hunt. (then) That’s when everything changed.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Tell me what happened.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: He started asking me to stay late, have drinks, go to dinner...

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Did you?  A Legal Mind 40.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: At first I thought it was for work, so, yes. But it started to not feel right, so I just did my job and went home. One night, Mr. Hunt called me into his office and told me if I slept with him, he’d take care of me within the firm, and if I didn’t... he said he would fire me.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Did he use those exact words? Was he that explicit?

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: No. He’s not stupid. But neither am I. And we both knew exactly what he meant.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: What did you do?

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: I went to human resources. They said they investigated and found nothing to support my claim. Two months later I was fired for poor job performance. I was told to clean out my desk immediately. She seems to be living it in her mind...

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: They wouldn’t let me say good-bye to anyone. They wouldn’t give me a letter of recommendation... they wouldn’t even allow me to get unemployment benefits. Mike looks like he wants to kill Mr. Charles Hunt.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: I wasn’t looking for a payoff. All I wanted was for it to stop. I feel so violated. Can you help me?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: There’s some good news and some bad news. The bad news is, as you said, he’s not stupid and it’s going to be hard to prove he propositioned you without a witness.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: What’s the good news?  A Legal Mind 4l.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: That’s not what we have to prove. The biggest exposure employers have isn’t the harassment itself, it’s the retaliation.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: What do you mean? Mike takes a sip of his coffee.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Your complaint is on record. Two months later you got fired for poor performance. All we have to prove is your performance stayed consistent, and we’ve got them. Nancy’s face falls.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: What’s the matter?

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: After what he said to me in that room -- I was under a lot of stress. It affected me. I couldn’t sleep. I couldn’t keep concentrate... my performance was poor. Mike looks at her and smiles bravely...

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Then we’re going to have to prove what he said to you in that room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike is updating Harvey on the case.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: You need my help? Give me an update.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: You know, she’s a nice woman. She --

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Not on the client. On the case. I don’t get emotionally attached to the clients.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: This woman's had her entire life ripped apart. You don’t care?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: I’m not about caring. I’m about winning.  A Legal Mind 42.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Why can’t you be about both?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: I'd explain it to you, but then I'd have to care about you, now give me an update.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Defense sent over the original files from the investigation as a courtesy, but I --

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: No they didn’t. Nobody does anything as a courtesy. They sent over those files because that’s where they want you to look. Listen to me, being a lawyer is like being a doctor.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: You mean how you don’t get emotional about the client?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: No. I mean, you keep pressing until it hurts, then you know where to look. (then) Forget about impeaching the investigation - it won't lead anywhere. No employee is going to testify against his own CEO. Mike smiles at this...

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: What would you suggest I do?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Think. If this guy’s done this once...

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: He’s done it before.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: And if people who work for him now won’t testify against him...

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: People who used to work for him might. (realizing) If I can find someone else he’s done it to, I’ve got corroboration, and I’ve got him nailed.  A Legal Mind 43.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: I’d subpoena the personnel records of every woman who’s left the firm during this guy’s tenure. Mike smiles as he holds up a subpoena.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: That’s exactly what I thought.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Then what do you need my help for?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I... don’t know how to fill out a subpoena. Harvey smiles and shakes his head. His boy is working out

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY, (INTO INTERCOM)
dialogues.text: Donna, I need you to show Mike how to fill out a subpoena.

dialogues.speaker: DONNA, (ON INTERCOM)
dialogues.text: No problem. After that you want me to show him how to wipe his ass? Harvey smiles, then looks at Mike.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: It’s funny, because you should already know how to do both those things. Harvey slides a card across his desk to Mike.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: What’s this?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: It’s my suit guy. Go in, tell him I sent you, and spend some goddamn money. Mike looks at the card.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: What does it matter how much money I spend on suits?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Because we're in the business of convincing people to do what we want. And like it or not, people respond to how you're dressed. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Legal Mind

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So if you want to be treated like you belong at this level, this is what you’re going to have to do.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Hey, you’re giving me advice. It sounds like you actually care about me.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: What I want you to understand is that you're a reflection of me. And as I told you before, I damn sure care about me. INT. MIKE’S CUBICLE - A LITTLE LATER Rachel approaches Mike as he puts his jacket on to leave.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: It’s six o’clock. I’m going home. Rachel laughs.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: What’s so funny?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: You're a rookie associate. If you go home before nine on your first week, you won’t make it through your first month. (then) Louis Litt wants to see you. Mike gets up to go see Louis. He hesitates, then:

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Do you think this suit makes me look like a Bar Mitzvah boy? INT. LOUIS’S OFFICE - MINUTES LATER Louis is at his desk. Mike sits across from him.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: I know you had orientation from Rachel, but I'd like to give you a special welcome from me. Among other things, I’m sort of the disciplinarian of the associates. An associate, GARY appears at the door and addresses Loui  A Legal Mind 45.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: You wanted to see me?

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Yes, please. Come on in, Gary. Mike, this is Gary Lipsky. Gary’s one of our promising associates from last year. Mike and Gary shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Gary, Mr. Pearson wanted me to ask if you've completed the Petramco filing.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: My brother was in over the weekend...

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: This is third time I’ve asked you.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: I‘1l get right on it.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Don’t bother. You’re fired.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: What?! You can’t -- Louis stands up.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: I can. And I did. Go pack your things, and don’t ever show your face here again. Gary exits the office, stunned... Louis turns to Mike.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: I arranged for you to see that because we pay our associates very well and provide the opportunity of unlimited advancement. But in return we expect results. Have I made myself clear?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Welcome to Pearson, Hardman. Louis then reads a file as though Mike isn’t there. A bea

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Feel free to go back to work.  A Legal Mind

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey exits for the night. He runs into Katherine...

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Harvey. How’s the new kid doing?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Pretty good.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: What do you have him working on? Harvey doesn’t want to tell her he dropped the case on Mi

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: This and that. Various matters. Katherine looks at Harvey curiously... INT. MIKE’S STUDIO APARTMENT - LATER THAT NIGHT Mike comes home to find Trevor on his couch, watching TV.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: Watching Sportscenter. Boo-yah. Trevor gives Mike a big smile. Nothing. He gets serious.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: You won’t return my calls.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Yeah, because you set me up.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: You think I knew about that?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Here we go, round fifty of I get shafted, because you didn’t know the whole story. Now Trevor tries righteousness.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: Hey, you knew there were risks when you quoted that shit from that book. You knew it, you needed the money, and I came through with an opportunity like always. Trevor realizes this tack won't work. He goes for sympath 46.  A Legal Mind 47.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: You know, you’re not the only one who got screwed. They held a gun on me.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Oh, really? Why did they do that?

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: To keep me from warning you.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: So you did know.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: Not until after it was too late.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Well it’s damn sure too late now. Mike holds the door open for Trevor to leave.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: Let me make it up to you.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: You want to make it up? Give me my key.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: (giving key, cajoling) Mike, come on, you know I don’t want to live in a world where we’re not tight.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Then kill yourself. Now get the hell out. Trevor exits. Mike checks for the briefcase. It’s there. He opens it to make sure it’s still full of pot. It is...

dialogues.speaker: END OF ACT THREE
dialogues.text: A Legal Mind 48.

dialogues.speaker: ACT FOUR
dialogues.text: INT. MIKE’S CUBICLE - NEXT AFTERNOON Mike opens an envelope, reads it and quickly heads off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey leaves his office and passes Donna on the way out.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Donna, I need the -- She instantly hands him an envelope clearly full of cash.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Oh, also I didn’t get a chance to -- She gives him a coffee to go. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Marry me.

dialogues.speaker: DONNA
dialogues.text: I took care of that too. We’ve been married for the last seven years. Harvey smiles and heads out. Mike approaches, concerned.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: The company’s fighting the subpoena. They filed a motion to dismiss the case based on our lack of evidence. Harvey doesn’t stop walking.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Good. Mike stands there a beat, then walks after Harvey.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Good. What do you mean good?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: They don’t want to hand over the files. You pressed where it hurt. You’re looking in the right place. Mike catches up. They keep walking to the elevators.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Did you think they wouldn’t fight back?  A Legal Mind 49.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Well... I... now that you mention it.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: It's my fault. I keep forgetting you don’t actually know anything. The idea is you make a move, they make a move and back and forth til one of you wins.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: But what if they win the motion and the case gets dismissed? Harvey arrives at the elevators and presses the down butt

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Then you’re not as good as you think you are. The elevator door opens. Katherine is in it. She stays in as the rest of the people file out...

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: What a coincidence. I was just wondering how it’s going with the pro bono case.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Fantastic, I’m all over it. Katherine is now alone in the elevator. Harvey gets on.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: That makes me happy. Because if I were to find out you weren't giving it your full effort, I would be very upset... Concern registers on Harvey's face as the door closes. Mi turns to go back to his cubicle. He sees Rachel, catches to her and follows her through the halls back to her offi

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I need your help. There’s a hearing on my subpoena.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I’ve got three other cases ahead of yours, so you’ll have to wait in line.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: But my hearing is tomorrow. She stops outside of her office and turns to Mike.  A Legal Mind 50.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Why are you coming to me?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Because Donna says you’re the best researcher in the firm.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Let me see the motion. Mike hands it to her. She reads it as they enter her offi INT. RACHEL’S OFFICE - CONTINUOUS Mike sees Rachel’s office is much nicer than his cubicle.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Wait. You have an office? Why do you have an office and I only have a cubicle? Rachel smiles.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Like you said, I’m the best researcher in the firm.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Really? I just made that up. I didn’t even have time to talk to Donna. Mike smiles. Rachel isn’t amused.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Is this all a joke to you? Because I take my job seriously.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, I was just -- I care about this woman. She’s got nowhere else to turn and -- I can’t help her by myself. Rachel looks at Mike and sees he’s sincere. He puts his hands up to his head as though they are dog ears and then flaps one of them over. Rachel breaks into a smile.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I get it. You’re a puppy. Do mea favor, don’t poop on my laptop. Rachel looks back down at the file, then back at Mike:

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: You're asking to look at private files without any evidence of your assertion.  A Legal Mind 51.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: But the only way we can find the evidence is by looking at those files.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: That's a rickety argument.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: But is there precedent? She sees a stack of files in her in-box, then looks at Mi

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Let’s go see if we can find one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Rachel enter a miniature version of the Harvard library. Highly sophisticated, well stocked and beautiful

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Research is as much art as science, we’ll look at privacy and harassment law and see if we can find a combination of cases to make an argument. I/’11 take privacy.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I’ll take harassment law...

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: This’ll take a while. We need dinner.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Chinese?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I can afford Chinese myself. This is on the firm, I want sushi. We see a montage of them reading books, journals, etc... show each other what they’ve found and shake their heads, won't work. Dinner comes... as they finish their sushi.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Remember when I said you thought you were too smart to be a paralegal?... Why --

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: -- aren’t I a lawyer? Rachel looks at Mike and decides to reveal her vulnerabil

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I don’t test well.  A Legal Mind 52.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I’m smart, I know I’d be a good lawyer, but... I can’t take tests. I don’t know what happens to me. I bombed the LSAT’s. Even if I could get into a law school, there’s no way I’d ever pass the bar. (wistfully) If only there were some way to have someone take the tests for me. Mike laughs.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Yeah, if only there were. Harvey walks in and sees them smiling at each other.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Where are you on the research for tomorrow's hearing?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Nothing yet.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: You say you care about the client. But if you keep playing footsie with the paralegal instead of finding me a valid argument, the client’s going to lose. Harvey exits. We resume the montage of Mike and Rachel working. Again, nothing is working. More frustration.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: It’s no use. They did an investigation and they did it by the book. It produced no evidence, and we look like the bad guys coming in putting them under duress.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Wait a second, what did you say?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I said we look like the bad guys.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: No. You said they did it by the book, and we’re putting them under duress.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: So?  A Legal Mind 53.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
