dialogues.text: They didn’t do it by the book. The investigation was done under duress... Mike picks up one of the books and shows it to Rachel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey eats with VANESSA, a gorgeous woman in a killer dr

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: So, we get there and my client decides it’ll be funny to introduce me to his pastor as a recovering sex addict.

dialogues.speaker: VANESSA
dialogues.text: What did you do?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: I hold out my hand to the pastor and go, “Who said anything about recovering?” Vanessa laughs. They share a moment... then:

dialogues.speaker: VANESSA
dialogues.text: I believe you have something for me?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: That’s what I love about you, Vanessa. Business over pleasure. Harvey puts the envelope of cash Donna gave him on the ta

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: By the way, that dress... damn.

dialogues.speaker: VANESSA
dialogues.text: This old thing? It was my father’s. Vanessa counts the money in the envelope and puts it away

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Vanessa, how come you and I never...

dialogues.speaker: VANESSA
dialogues.text: Because I don’t sleep around. And I could never have a relationship with you. All you ever think about is yourself.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: That’s ridiculous. I’m thinking about you and me right now. Vanessa smiles and shakes her head as she gets up to leav  A Legal Mind 54.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: By the way, I’m not selfish everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: VANESSA
dialogues.text: Neither am I. But you’ll never know it. Vanessa hands Harvey a manila folder and heads off. Harve watches her go, then looks opens the folder and looks ins

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike stands as Harvey peruses his handiwork.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: This is good. We’re gonna have some fun.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Did... you say we?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: You didn’t think I was going to let you come along?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Good instinct, I wasn’t. Then I thought it would be cruel not to let you witness my greatness. Mike smiles.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: You're a true giver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey, Mike and DEFENSE COUNSEL are arguing the motion t dismiss in front of a JUDGE, BAILIFF and STENOGRAPHER...

dialogues.speaker: DEFENSE COUNSEL
dialogues.text: Your honor, this case should be thrown out. Other than her story, plaintiff doesn't have one piece of evidence.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Because the evidence lies within their personnel files, which they’re conveniently refusing to hand over.  A Legal Mind 55.

dialogues.speaker: DEFENSE COUNSEL
dialogues.text: Those files have sensitive information. He's fishing at the expense of our employees’ right to privacy. Harvey scoffs.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Please, he doesn't give a rat's ass about his employees' right to privacy.

dialogues.speaker: DEFENSE COUNSEL
dialogues.text: Your honor, Mr. Specter’s claim that we don’t care about our employees, though witty, carries no weight as a rule of law.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: True. But what does carry weight is that under Article Seven of the statute, the investigation of sexual harassment must be conducted without any duress.

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: Your point? Harvey walks the courtroom with ease as he makes his case

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Both the investigator and every person interviewed answers to the CEO they're investigating. That is the definition of duress. It’d be like your bailiff accused you of sexual harassment, and you assigned your stenographer to investigate. How likely do you think it would be that the investigation yielded any fruit?

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: You honestly think I would harass Herman? Harvey looks at the bailiff, a slovenly, fifty year old m

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: I don’t know, your honor. Some people have a thing for the uniform..

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: I'd like to think Herman would come to me before it got to an investigation. Harvey glances at Herman. Herman shakes his head no.

dialogues.speaker: DEFENSE COUNSEL
dialogues.text: I saw that. That should be stricken.  A Legal Mind 56. Harvey smiles, then continues to the Judge.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: And what if Herman did come to you, your honor? And you betrayed his trust by firing him under false pretenses?

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: You really think that little of me?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: I wouldn’t trust you as far as I could throw you, your honor. They share a smile.

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: Your point is taken.

dialogues.speaker: DEFENSE COUNSEL
dialogues.text: Your honor --

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: Hand over the files. Mike beams with their victory. The Judge addresses Harvey

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: But this doesn't go on forever. You've got one week to show me evidence backing up your claim or I'm dismissing the suit.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: But, your honor --

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: That's it, I’ve made my ruling, now Herman and I have some communicating to do. Mike turns to Harvey.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: That was awesome.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: It was your argument. I just framed it in a way that humanized the situation and brightened all of our afternoons.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I feel like Michael Corleone in that scene where the fat guy teaches him how to shoot the gun.  A Legal Mind 57.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Are you saying I’m the fat guy? (then) I am not the fat guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike walks into a world he never knew existed. The world’ finest suits are on display. He approaches RENE, who look him up and down in a condescending manner.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Excuse me, I’m looking for Rene.

dialogues.speaker: RENE
dialogues.text: I’m Rene. When’s the Bar Mitzvah?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Did Harvey tell you I was coming here? Rene looks at him with newfound respect.

dialogues.speaker: RENE
dialogues.text: Harvey Specter sent you? That’s another story. Do you know your inseam? Mike is amused at the notion that he would know his insea

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: No, I don’t.

dialogues.speaker: RENE
dialogues.text: My lucky day. Why don’t you browse for a minute. The suits are arranged by price. Starting with the least expensive here and moving up in price as you go back. Rene exits. Mike picks up an “inexpensive” suit. He sees the price: $2,000. He puts it back and walks out the door EXT. MANHATTAN STREET —- CONTINUOUS Mike exits quickly. He sees Rene prancing toward the fron window holding ten thousand dollars of clothing. Mike smi to himself at his getaway. His cell phone rings, he answe

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Mike, it’s Jenny.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Trevor's having you do his dirty work?  A Legal Mind 58.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Trevor doesn’t even know I’m calling you. And all I know is that you're not talking to each other and I miss you and I want things to go back to the way they were. This stops Mike short.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I miss you too. But I don’t think things are ever going back the way they were. Mike hangs up the phone. INT. TREVOR STEVENS’ CONDOMINIUM We see that Jenny is sitting there with Trevor.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: What did he say?

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: He said things aren’t ever going back the way they were. What did you do? A beat. Trevor lies.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: I don’t know. INT. RACHEL’S OFFICE - A LITTLE LATER Rachel is at her desk. Mike enters.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: The files are on their way. We have a week to corroborate Nancy’s story.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: We won?! That’s fantastic!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I couldn't have done it without you.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Damn right, you couldn’t have. You didn’t even know where to look without me.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: You know, nobody likes a show-off. Rachel smiles. Her intercom buzzes, she listens, then:  A Legal Mind 59.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: The files are in conference room C.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Why didn’t they bring them to my cubicle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike shows up. The conference room is filled with boxes u boxes. Mike looks at them all as Harvey approaches.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: They know you only have a week to find whoever it is you’re looking for.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: They're fighting back.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: They're trying to bury you in paperwork. Mike looks at Harvey with confidence.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: They picked the wrong guy.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: That’s what I like to hear. Now excuse me, I have to go charm a new client. INT. JOHN DOCKERY’S OFFICE - A LITTLE LATER John Dockery, CEO of Dockery Chemical shakes Harvey’s han

dialogues.speaker: DOCKERY
dialogues.text: Nice to finally meet you. Katherine says you're going to sweep me off my feet.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: I’ll do my best, Mr. Dockery. Harvey hands him the manila folder from Vanessa, he opens

dialogues.speaker: DOCKERY
dialogues.text: What the hell is this?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Looks to me like it’s you having sex with a woman who isn’t Mrs. Dockery.

dialogues.speaker: DOCKERY
dialogues.text: Are you trying to blackmail me?!  A Legal Mind 60. A beat:

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: No, I’m not. You asked my firm to see where you’re vulnerable to corporate take- over. This is where you’re vulnerable.

dialogues.speaker: DOCKERY
dialogues.text: What are you --

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Your wife owns fifteen percent of the voting shares of your company. As far as I can tell, you've been seeing this woman and several others for quite some time. How do you think your wife’s going to vote her shares after she finds out?

dialogues.speaker: DOCKERY
dialogues.text: Who says she has to find out?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Mr. Dockery, my investigator was able to obtain these pictures in a week. What do you think a motivated competitor of yours will be able to dig up in a year? This lands on Dockery. Harvey pours two glasses of water.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I have a simple solution. Trade her your preferred shares, which have no voting rights for her common shares, which do.

dialogues.speaker: DOCKERY
dialogues.text: The preferred shares are worth two million dollars more.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: A fraction of what you’ll lose if you get voted out of your company. Harvey offers a glass to Dockery. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: DOCKERY
dialogues.text: You looking down your nose at me?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: John, please, I don’t care if you sleep with the entire Knick’s dancers. Just give her the preferred shares. Harvey smiles. Dockery takes the glass.  A Legal Mind 61.

dialogues.speaker: DOCKERY
dialogues.text: Katherine said you were going to charm me to get my business.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: I’m not interested in getting your business. I’m interested in keeping it. Harvey and Dockery share a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike enters. He’s been up all night and all the next day.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I know where they don’t want us to look.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: You got through those files by yourself in a day and a half?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I would have done it faster, but I ordered a pizza. Have you tried that Papa John’s crazy bread? It’s fantastic. (off look, coming clean) Rachel helped me. Half the files were men. Another chunk were women over sixty. I read the rest. Harvey smiles at Mike trying to pull one over on him.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Come on, it’s still impressive!

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: What did you find?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: We pieced together from the records there was a dismissal on March 12, 2002. But the file containing the employee name is missing. That’s our woman, I know it. I’m moving to slap monetary sanctions on their attorney, possible jail time... this guy isn’t gonna know what hit him. A beat. Harvey dials his phone. It rings on speaker.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Phil, it’s Harvey Specter. Did you have anything to do with the March 12th, 2002 files being left out of discovery?  A Legal Mind 62.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL, (ON SPEAKER)
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: If the file is here by noon, I'll believe you, if not we’re filing for sanctions... Harvey hangs up the phone and looks at Mike.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Threat of sanctions is better than filing for sanctions.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: That’s what I meant. I was going to threaten him. Not file. I meant that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike sits with Nancy again...

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Nancy, did you know, or have you ever heard of a woman named Joanna Webster?

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: No. Not that I can think of. Why?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: The company tried to hide her existence from us. Her records show she met with personnel over “work related issues,” in 2002, then was let go two months later.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: You think Hunt did the same thing to her that he did to me?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Yes, I do.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Then get her to come forward and say so. Mike knows that’s not going to be easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike knocks on the door of an apartment. A woman, JOANNA WEBSTER answers, she looks surprisingly similar to Nancy.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Can I help you?  A Legal Mind

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Joanna Webster, my name is Mike Ross, I’m a lawyer. I have some questions about your time at Devlin McGreggor. Joanna hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Please, just let me tell you a story about my client, Nancy Johnson... INT. JOANNA’S LIVING ROOM - A LITTLE LATER Mike and Joanna sit, he’s clearly just told her about Nan

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: That sounds about the same as what happened to me. But --

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Please, all I need you to do is tell your story. If you corroborate Nancy’s --

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Mr. Ross, what happened to me, happened seven years ago. It was violating and horrible and there was a reason I didn’t do anything about it. I know what they do. They’1ll put me on that stand and attack me and I don’t want that.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Joanna, this man is a predator. He did it to you, he did it to Nancy, and if you don’t help stop him, he’1ll do it again. Mike takes her hand.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I'll be with you every step of the way. All you have to do is give a deposition tomorrow, and then testify again on Friday in front of the judge.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, I can’t do it. Mike’s face falls...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey is working late at his desk. Mike enters and slump into a chair, completely dejected...  A Legal Mind 64.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: What happened with the witness? Mike becomes instantly excited:

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I got her to testify! You should've seen me. I threw everything at her. Told her if she didn’t stop him he’d do it again, I'd be with her every step of the way... Mike holds out his arms to Harvey in amazement. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: It didn’t work! I was done. I had nothing. Then it hit me, I asked her what if it was her daughter she was testifying for... she melted. I used empathy to get her to testify. (starts singing) Testify. Testify. She’s gonna testify. Harvey looks at Mike:

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Well, I’m glad to see the fact that you were up all night didn’t make you giddy. (smiles, then) Now go get some sleep. I don’t want you singing during tomorrow’s deposition. Mike leaves. Harvey smiles to himself as Katherine enters A moment.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Harvey, how’s it going with the pro bono?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: I just talked a witness into testifying.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Really? What’s the witness’s name? Harvey has no idea of the answer. He’s caught...

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: I’m not an idiot. Don’t treat me like one. You pawned off the case.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: I’m sorry you feel that way, but --  A Legal Mind

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Damn it Harvey, I told you this was a way for you to show that you thought about more than just yourself.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: I’ve got higher profile cases that --

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Need I remind you when we met, you were a 28 year old screw up? I gave you a shot at the mail room, led you up the ranks to paralegal, then paid for you to go to Harvard Law. Where by the way you fucked off the whole time and I still hired you.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: And you've benefitted from that ever since. I closed Dockery for you yesterday and I can’t make time to --

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: You made a promise to me! You made a promise, you broke it, and then you lied to my face. So, let me be clear, this isn’t professional, this is personal. And I‘1l tell you something else, you made your bed, you better goddamn win. Katherine leaves. Harvey realizes he let his mentor down. INT. MIKE’S STUDIO APARTMENT - LATER THAT NIGHT Mike enters his apartment, elated. It’s been ransacked.
A Legal Mind

dialogues.speaker: ACT FIVE
dialogues.text: INT. MIKE’S STUDIO APARTMENT —- CONTINUOUS Mike surveys his ransacked apartment. A beat, he runs to oven, the briefcase is still there. He dials his cell...

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: What the hell is wrong with you?

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: I need you to give me that briefcase back.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: So that’s what this has all been about. You don’t care about our friendship. You just wanted the briefcase back.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: That’s not true. You’re my oldest friend and you know it. But you don’t seem to care about that anymore, so, yes, I also need the briefcase back.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: That’s too bad, because I don’t have it.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: Who throws something like that away?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I do. And by the way, I thought I had you give me my key back.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: You think I wouldn’t have made a backup? Mike, come on, why are you playing games?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I told you. I don’t have it. I ditched it while I was running away from the cops you sent me into.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: I don’t believe you. You can’t -- Mike hangs up the phone. INT. MIKE’S STUDIO APARTMENT - NEXT MORNING Mike is dressed. He goes to the oven, opens it, takes out the briefcase, and heads out to work with it...  A Legal Mind 67.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike exits the elevator. As he passes the receptionist...

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Mike, hold it right there. Mike freezes. He turns around to see Louis Litt.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Where do you think you’re going? A beat.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: To my cubicle.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: No, you're not. It’s pee in a cup time.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Drug test. Follow me.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: No problem. Mike hesitates. He looks down at his briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I’m just gonna put my things back at my --

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Now. Louis starts walking. Mike isn’t sure what to do. A beat. Mike follows Louis to the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Louis ride the elevator down in silence. Ding. T door opens. They exit into a significantly less polished floor of the firm. INT. PEARSON, HARDMAN —- HALLWAY - CONTINUOUS Mike nervously follows Louis into the bowels of the firm. Their feet click as they make their way down the hall.  A Legal Mind

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: By the way, my cousin was your year at Harvard. It’s funny. I asked if he remembered you. He didn’t.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: What’s his name?

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Mitch Samberg. Another beat.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Didn’t know him... big school. Louis looks at Mike, “not that big.” Then he stops, opens door and motions for Mike to go through.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Time to face the music. INT. DONNA’S DESK - SAME Harvey approaches Donna. He’s a little anxious.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Donna, they’re on the way for Mike’s deposition. I’ve got to get to the Kendrick filing. Where the hell is Mike?

dialogues.speaker: DONNA
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Harvey nervously paces back to his office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Louis enter. The room looks like the examination room in a doctor’s office. There is a technician there, w hands Mike a plastic cup and indicates a bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: TECHNICIAN
dialogues.text: Leave the cup on the counter. Mike leaves the room: The technician points at his briefc

dialogues.speaker: TECHNICIAN
dialogues.text: You'll have to leave that out here.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Why? 68.  A Legal Mind 69.

dialogues.speaker: TECHNICIAN
dialogues.text: If you take it in there with you, I have to check to make sure you don’t have another urine sample in it. Mike looks at Louis, sets the briefcase down and enters t bathroom. Louis looks at the briefcase suspiciously...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike exits the bathroom. He sees Louis is gone. He breath a sign of relief, picks up the briefcase and exits. INT. MIKE’S CUBICLE - MINUTES LATER Mike enters his cubicle, opens a desk drawer, puts the briefcase in it, closes the drawer and locks it.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Where have you been? Mike is startled again. He turns to see Harvey.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I was being drug tested. Why?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: The deposition’s this afternoon. I’m going to handle it. I want you to dig into this woman's background and find anything they'll use against her. And grill her. Make her tell you everything. I want to be prepared. Now go... Mike picks up his other briefcase and heads off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey, Mike, the Defense Attorney, Joanna and a STENOGRA are all there. Joanna takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: I'd been working for Mr. Hunt six months when he started asking me to work late, order dinner... One night, late, he... tried to sleep with me. The next day, I went to HR to request a change of assignment. And two months later I was fired for having a bad attitude. Defense Counsel starts in...  A Legal Mind 70.

dialogues.speaker: DEFENSE COUNSEL
dialogues.text: Ms. Webster, after working for Devlin McGreggor, you went on to waitress at Hooters, did you not?

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Yes, I did.

dialogues.speaker: DEFENSE COUNSEL
dialogues.text: A place that advertises the sexuality of its waitresses to get business?

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: You'll have to ask them that.

dialogues.speaker: DEFENSE COUNSEL
dialogues.text: I'm asking you.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: And she’s not answering. It has no relevance. Let’s move on. Mike looks at Joanna reassuringly.

dialogues.speaker: DEFENSE COUNSEL
dialogues.text: Ms. Webster, are you a truthful person?

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: DEFENSE COUNSEL
dialogues.text: When you said earlier that you’d never been arrested for a crime, were you telling the truth then?

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Yes. Defense counsel holds up a folder.

dialogues.speaker: DEFENSE COUNSEL
dialogues.text: In 1999 you weren’t arrested for stealing a thousand dollars worth of jewelry from the Willow Grove mall in Pennsylvania? Joanna's face falls. Mike looks at Harvey, “Oh, shit.”

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: I was seventeen. It was one mistake. Those records were supposed to be sealed.  A Legal Mind 71.

dialogues.speaker: DEFENSE COUNSEL
dialogues.text: So, when you say those records were sealed, what you mean is that you thought you could get away with a lie?

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: No, that’s not it. I knew you would twist it around and make it seem different that it is.

dialogues.speaker: DEFENSE COUNSEL
dialogues.text: You've been arrested in your past. Then you lied about it under oath. Is that making it seem different than what it is? Joanna looks at Mike and Harvey. They can’t help her.

dialogues.speaker: DEFENSE COUNSEL
dialogues.text: No answer? Then I ask this, since you lied here once, what’s to make us believe you’re not lying about Mr. Hunt? Joanna runs out of the room. Mike looks at Harvey.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Fix it. Mike runs out after Joanna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike runs up to Joanna, who keeps walking...

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Joanna, wait...

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: This is why I didn’t want to testify. They twist some thing from a hundred years ago and make me look like a liar. She turns to Mike.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: They make it sound like what he did to me didn’t happen.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Look, I know it was hard. But it doesn’t matter what happened in there. I need you to have the courage to give testimony to the Judge on Friday to keep this case alive. I don’t have time to find someone else between now and then...  A Legal Mind 72. She looks at him, then starts walking again...

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Wait --

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: No. I’m not waiting. You promised me this wouldn’t happen and it did.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: You never told me you were arrested.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Please don’t contact me again. Mike watches as his chance to win walks away. INT. MIKE’S CUBICLE - LATER Mike sits with his head in hands. Harvey approaches him.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I couldn’t convince her to stand her ground and tell the truth anyway.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: How the hell did you miss that arrest?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I don’t know. I went to Rachel, we did every background check we have.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Did you grill her like I told you to?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: It was a sealed record!

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Goddamn it, I knew it! You didn’t grill her because you were afraid to make her uncomfortable. That’s why I don’t get emotionally involved. So I can ask the tough questions that you won't. Mike starts packing up his things.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: So, you're going to quit?  A Legal Mind 73.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: It’s either that or wait for Louis to fire me.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: My first day, Louis fired Gary Lipsky for screwing up a case. He said if I did the same thing I’d be gone as fast as Gary.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Then go to your witness’ house and try to get her to testify again.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I’m telling you, I was there today. There’s no way.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: There’s always a way.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Then why don’t you go over there and convince her.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Because you screwed it up.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: And you don’t give a damn about the client.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: That’s not my job.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Does your job include giving a damn about me? Because the least you could do is offer to stand up to Louis Litt for me. This pisses Harvey off.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Stand up for you?! I put my ass on the line for you, and the first roadblock you stumble into you want to quit. Being a success is about knowing the difference between having balls and having courage.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: And what is that?  A Legal Mind 74.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: You had the balls to get this job, but you don’t have the courage to stick it out when it gets tough.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: That’s not true.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Isn’t it? You’ve had one foot out the door since you got here.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: I'm talking about that second briefcase locked in your desk. (off Mike’s look) Yeah, I saw it. And I know what it is. It’s a backup plan in case this doesn’t work out. You can make some quick cash and go right back to the life you told me you didn’t want to lead. This hits Mike hard.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: So, if you want to quit, go ahead. But it isn’t because of Louis Litt, it isn’t because of me and isn’t because of your witness. It’s because you’re afraid you might fail and then you’ll have to look yourself in the mirror and admit you're not as smart as you think you are. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Now go home and think about that. If you're here in the morning, I'll know I still have an associate. Harvey turns and walks away. Mike throws a stack of paper against the wall in frustration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike is riding the subway with his box of things and one his briefcases at his feet. The subway stops. He gets off  A Legal Mind 75. INT. MIKE’S STUDIO APARTMENT - LATER Mike enters and flops on the couch. He sits, not knowing what to do. He reaches under the couch and pulls out his bong. He takes some pot out, puts it in the bong and ligh a match. Before he takes the hit, he blows out the match puts it all down in disgust. He gets up and leaves. INT. NURSING HOME - MIKE’S GRANDMOTHER’S ROOM - LATER Mike enters Grammy’s room. She’s asleep. He sits down nex to her and holds her hand. She wakes and sees him in a su

dialogues.speaker: GRAMMY
dialogues.text: Michael, look at you... I’m so proud.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Grammy, I made good on my promise, but... I want to quit. I can’t take it.

dialogues.speaker: GRAMMY
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Because I can’t do the things I’m supposed to do.

dialogues.speaker: GRAMMY
dialogues.text: Michael, when your parents died, I lost my son and my daughter-in-law. I was scared, alone and too old to raise you. She looks him in the eye and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: GRAMMY
dialogues.text: But I had no choice. I had to make do... because who else was going to care for my grandson? I wasn’t going to give you up unless they ripped you from my arms. Grammy takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: GRAMMY
dialogues.text: You made me a promise before. You're in the door. Promise me now the only way you'll leave is if they rip you out.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I promise. Mike hugs her and exits. As before, he mumbles to himself

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I just have to do one thing first.  A Legal Mind 76. INT. LOUIS’S OFFICE - LATER THAT NIGHT Louis is working late. Harvey storms in.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Louis, I get that you were upset because I was promoted before you. But if you ever threaten to fire an associate of mine again, I’m gonna kick your ass.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Don’t play dumb with me. You fired Gary Lipsky in front of Mike Ross. Louis smirks.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: What’s so funny?

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: Gary Lipsky works in the mail room.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: He was a plant. I didn’t fire anybody. It was just my way of letting Mike know what’s expected of him.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: What’s wrong with you? You planted a fake an employee to manipulate Mike and -- A light bulb goes off in Harvey’s mind.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: That’s it. (then, to Louis) You make me sick. Louis seethes as Harvey runs out. INT. TREVOR STEVENS’ CONDOMINIUM - A LITTLE LATER Mike, holding the briefcase, uses his key to let himself Trevor's. Trevor and Jenny are immediately happy to see h

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR/JENNY
dialogues.text: Mike!/Thank god.  A Legal Mind 77.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I’m not giving this back because you want it, I’m giving it back because I don’t need it. Mike puts the briefcase in front of Trevor. Jenny looks a Trevor, he’s going to have some explaining to do...

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I don’t know if I’m ever going to forgive you or not, but I know this: We’re even. Mike throws the key to Trevor’s place back to Trevor.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Wait a second... Mike heads into Trevor’s bedroom. He comes back out holdi all of Trevor's two thousand dollars suits. As he exits..

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Now we’re even. EXT. PHILLIP’S TOWN HOME - LATER THAT NIGHT Katherine rings Phillip’s doorbell. He answers. INT. PHILLIP’S TOWN HOME - LIVING ROOM - MOMENTS LATER Phillip pours them each a drink. He hands her the glass..

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: Katherine, did you think he was going to change overnight?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: I’m worried he isn’t going to change at all. I'’11 lose the best attorney I’ve got.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: If you care about Harvey, putting him through the ringer is his only chance. Katherine takes a drink of her whiskey.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Remember when I was coming up, it was a different time. Women weren’t welcome -- I took a lot of cheap shots you never knew about. Phillip looks at Katherine, “Didn’t I?”  A Legal Mind 78.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: Those cheap shots forged you into the woman you are today.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: My point is most men get hazed and think, “I went through it, I’m gonna stick it to the next guy.” I always felt, “I hated that. Why put someone else through it?” Phillip drinks his whiskey and smiles at the irony.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: Then you need to learn to be harder, so Harvey can learn to be softer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey knocks on Joanna Webster’s front door. She opens i

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Who are you? What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: I work with Mike Ross.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: Well, you can save your breath, because I told Mike there’s no way I’m going testify at that hearing tomorrow. She closes the door. Harvey stops it.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: That’s not why I’m here. I know what you did.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? Harvey enters her place as she slowly backs away.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: You're a plant. A fake employee. You never worked at Devlin McGreggor, and you were never harassed by Mr. Hunt.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: That’s not --

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: I could tell you I’ve got the canceled check, or the wire transfer, or whatever smoking gun that exists, but I don’t.  A Legal Mind 79. Harvey looks her dead in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: But I will. And when I do, you’1l be going to jail. Unless you tell me what happened right now. Joanna Webster doesn’t know what to do.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: I’m the guy you tell. A moment.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNA
dialogues.text: All I had to do was waste your time until the hearing tomorrow. Please, I needed the money, I don’t want to go to jail...

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Here's what you're going to do...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey's at his desk. Mike enters, sheepishly. Harvey smiles.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: I see you came to work today. Nice suit.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: It was a barter transaction. I got twelve of them for one little briefcase. Harvey smiles. He’s proud of Mike. Mike gets serious.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Listen, I’m sorry and --

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Forget it. When I started, Katherine rode me so hard, I quit once a month. I just told you what you needed to hear. Mike still needs to say what he was going to say...

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: That’s just it. When I was ten my mom and dad died in a car accident. After a thing like that, you don’t trust anything or anyone. Except my Grammy. She raised me, she did the best she could... Mike takes a deep breath and gets emotional.  A Legal Mind 80.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: She always told me what I needed to hear. Mike looks at Harvey.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I guess it’s time I trusted someone else. A moment. Harvey is moved. He tosses Mike a file.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Merry Christmas. Mike looks through the file, absorbs it contents, then:

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: What would you have done with this if I hadn’t come in today?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: I'd have used it myself. Harvey lets it sink in that if Mike hadn’t come in today, Harvey wouldn’t have tracked him down. Then:

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: You know what to do?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Press until it hurts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike slaps down a piece of paper. SLAM!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Wire transfer from your account in the amount of five thousand dollars. We reveal that Mike is standing in front of Mr. Hunt and defense counsel. Harvey sits quietly at the table along w Nancy. Mike slaps down another piece of paper. SLAM!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Phone records proving multiple contacts with Joanna Webster prior to her testimony. Another document. SLAM!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: An affidavit stating you paid Ms. Webster to falsely testify. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Legal Mind 81.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mr. Hunt, harassment is a civil violation, for which you were being sued. Witness tampering is a crime, for which you will go to prison. Mike gathers up the pieces of paper.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: And I guarantee you’re going to learn more about the act of unwanted sexual advances than you ever thought possible.

dialogues.speaker: MR. HUNT
dialogues.text: You think this is gonna intimidate me?! Even if this evidence was credible, who are you going to get to prosecute me for some piss-ant witness tampering charge? Mike turns to Harvey.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Harvey, didn’t you graduate law school with New York’s current U.S. Attorney?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: In fact I did. I think he might be interested in pursuing a case like this.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Are you two close?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: I was the best man at his wedding.

dialogues.speaker: MR. HUNT
dialogues.text: No you weren't. You're bluffing. Harvey nods to Mike, who puts pictures in front of Mr. Hu

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Here’s us at graduation. He’s sad ‘cause he just found out I outranked him. (then) Here’s one with the District Attorney. I wouldn't show him this case, though. He’d push for the death penalty. (then) Here’s one of us at a bachelor party. It was lame, no strippers. But he can’t put guys like you away for sexual harassment then go to strip clubs now, can he?

dialogues.speaker: DEFENSE COUNSEL
dialogues.text: What do you want?  A Legal Mind 82. Mike looks at Nancy, then addresses Mr. Hunt.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: A statement admitting what you did, your resignation, and a guarantee you will obtain treatment before working again. Mr. Hunt nods his head yes.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: And Nancy gets reinstated with back pay, a raise, and damages in the amount of four years tuition for her son at the most expensive university in the country.

dialogues.speaker: DEFENSE COUNSEL
dialogues.text: Are we done?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Yes, we’re done. Defense counsel and Mr. Hunt exit. Nancy turns to Mike.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: This is everything I wanted. My job back, my dignity, a future for Freddie... Harvey smiles as Nancy hugs Mike...

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: I can’t thank you enough.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: It was my pleasure. Nancy shakes Harvey’s hand. Harvey and Mike exit the room

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey and Mike walk out of the courthouse.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Okay, I just have one question, why did you go to Joanna Webster’s house?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Because I figured it out.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I think you did it because you cared about me.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: I did it because it’s my job.  A Legal Mind

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Admit it, you cared. I saw the smile on your face when I showed up this morning.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: I didn’t smile.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Say what you want. You know it, and I know it, you smiled. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: I was thinking of a funny joke. INT. KATHERINE’S OFFICE - THAT NIGHT Harvey enters, contrite.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: You know we won.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Frankly, Harvey, I don’t care. A moment. This lands on Harvey. He’s probably never said:

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: I broke a promise to you. I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: (steely) Make it up to me. She tosses hima file. He reads it.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: This is a criminal case. I don’t --

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: The man’s innocent. He’s got a family. He needs a winner.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: (putting it together) You took my partnership away, folded instantly when I threatened you, then asked me to take a pro bono. Now you’re asking me to do this?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: I’m not saying you can’t still do the fun stuff. And this is a paying case... 83.  A Legal Mind 84.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: What I’m wondering is, have you just been manipulating me this whole time into some kind of... personal growth?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Am I smart enough to do that? Harvey holds up the file.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Is this the last one?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: I don’t make promises I can’t keep. INT. MIKE’S CUBICLE - LATER THAT NIGHT Mike heads out, Harvey joins him and hands him the file..

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: We start on this tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Does this mean we're officially a team?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: I wouldn't move your things into Wayne Manor just yet.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: So, now you're Batman?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Closer to him than the fat Godfather guy. They approach the elevator as the door opens...

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: George Clooney?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Christian Bale. Mike shakes his head no as the elevator the door closes.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Did you really quit when you were first here?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Of course not. I’m not a wuss.
